bible.text: As saith the proverb of the ancients, Wickedness proceedeth from the wicked: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.
He that troubles his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
He that walks with wise men shall be wise, but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.
Iron whets iron.
It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.
It is more blessed to give than to receive.
Let no man deceive you with vain words.
Many are called but few are chosen.
No man can serve two masters.
Open rebuke is better than secret love.
A good name is better than precious ointment.
A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches.
A just man falls seven times, and rises up again.
A prudent wife is from the Lord.
A soft answer turns away wrath.
Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
As a dog returns to his vomit, so a fool returns to his folly.
Before honor is humility.
Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in the power of your hand to do so.
Seek and ye shall find.
Speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee.
Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
Stupid people always think they are right. Wise people listen to advice.
The borrower is servant to the lender.
The heart of fools proclaims foolishness.
The prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
The rebellious dwell in a dry land.
The righteous are bold as a lion.
The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.
The wise man looks ahead. The fool attempts to fool himself and won't face facts.

There are three things that are too amazing for me, four that I do not understand: the way of an eagle in the sky, the way of a snake on a rock, the way of a ship on the high seas, and the way of a man with a maiden.
There is nothing new under the sun.
Wealth makes many friends.
Where there is no vision, people perish.
Wisdom is more precious than rubies.
Your own friend, and your father's friend, forsake not.
The wise man looks ahead. The fool attempts to fool himself and won't face facts.

There are three things that are too amazing for me, four that I do not understand: the way of an eagle in the sky, the way of a snake on a rock, the way of a ship on the high seas, and the way of a man with a maiden.
There is nothing new under the sun.
Wealth makes many friends.
Where there is no vision, people perish.
Wisdom is more precious than rubies.
Your own friend, and your father's friend, forsake not.
Do you see a man who is wise in his own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
Don't run too far, you will have to return the same distance.
Even a fool, when he holds his peace, is counted wise.
Every wise woman builds her house: but the fool plucks it down with her hands.
Faith moves mountains.
Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
Great men are not always wise.
He that is of a merry heart hasth a continual feast.
He that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
He that repeats a matter separates very friends.
Hatred stirs up strife, but love covers all transgressions
A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for a time of adversity
A man with many friends can still be ruined, but a true friend sticks closer than a brother
A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for a difficult time
He who oppresses the poor taunts his Maker, but he who is gracious to the needy honors Him
The man of integrity walks securely, but he who takes crooked paths will be found out
He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city
A person without self-control is like a city with broken-down walls
Do you see a man who is wise in his own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for him
Better a patient person than a warrior, one with self-control than one who takes a city
Where there is no vision, people perish.
Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God.
Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.
All wickedness is but little to the wickedness of a woman.
The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in the power of your hand to do so.
Perseverance must finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.
Where there is no vision, the people perish.
The heavens declare the glory of God, and the earth shows his handiwork.
The glory of young men is their strength, and the beauty of old men is their gray head.
For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.
A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil; but the fool rageth, and is confident.
But it is good to be zealously affected always in a good thing, and not only when I am present with you.
He that trusteth in his riches shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
Those who are peacemakers will plant seeds of peace and reap a harvest of goodness.
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control.
Greet one another with a holy kiss.
When I am weak, then am I strong.
Stupid people always think they are right. Wise people listen to advice.
Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.
There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under heaven.
A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
A good name is better than precious ointment.
A good name is more desirable than great riches.
Be not curious in unnecessary matters: for more things are shrewd unto thee than men understand.
Prove all things, hold fast to that which is true.
Where there is no law there is no transgression.
Whoever shuts his ears at the cry of the poor, they also shall cry themselves, but not be heard.
And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.
There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear.
Be ye therefore perfect, eve as your Father who is in heaven is perfect.
Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.
Sow to the wind and you will reap a whirlwind.
Seek and ye shall find.
If anyone has material possessions and sees his brother in need but has no pity on him, how can the love of God be in him?
He that loveth silver shall not be satisfied with silver, nor he that loveth abundance with increase: this is also vanity.
Take care that you do not despise one of these little ones; for I tell you, in heaven their angels continually see the face of my Father.
Live in harmony with one another. Do not be proud… or conceited.
Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
Let all things be done decently and in order.
My strength is made perfect in weakness.
Excellence is not being the best; it is doing your best.
The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
The wise man looks ahead. The fool attempts to fool himself and won’t face facts.
Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision: for the day of the Lord is near in the valley of decision.
Keep me as the apple of the eye; hide me under the shadow of thy wings.
For I bear them record that they have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge.
Thy word is a lamp to my feet, and a light to my path.
If you love only those who love you … if you help only those who help you …what merit is that to you?
God loveth a cheerful giver.
The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.
But he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.
The waters wear the stones: thou washeth away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.
Sorrow is better than laughter, for by the sadness of the face the heart is made better.
Charity suffereth long, and is kind; charity envieth not; charity vaulteth not itself, is not puffed up.
Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.
He that troubles his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
Every wise woman builds her house: but the fool plucks it down with her hands.
Even as I have seen, they that plough iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.
If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.
